messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 60 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Reduced polynomial invariant integrity basis for in-plane magneto-mechanical loading

Paper Abstract: Abstract. The description of the behavior of a material subjected to multi-physics loadings requires the formulation of constitutive laws that usually derive from Gibbs free energies, using invariant quantities depending on the considered physics and material symmetries. On the other hand, most of crystalline materials can be described by their crystalline texture and the associated preferred directions of strong crystalline symmetry (the so-called fibers). Moreover, among the materials produced industrially, many are manufactured in the form of sheets or of thin layers. This article has for object the study of the magneto-mechanical coupling which is a function of the stress ùùàùùà\boldsymbol{\sigma} and the magnetization ùë¥ùë¥\boldsymbol{M}. We consider a material with cubic symmetry whose texture can be described by one of three fibers denoted as Œ∏ùúÉ\theta, Œ≥ùõæ\gamma or Œ±‚Ä≤superscriptùõº‚Ä≤\alpha^{\prime}, and which is thin enough so that both the stress and the magnetization can be considered as in-plane quantities. We propose an algorithm able to derive linear relations between the 30 cubic invariants IksubscriptùêºùëòI_{k} of a minimal integrity basis describing a magneto-elastic problem, when they are restricted to in-plane loading conditions and for different fiber orientations. The algorithm/program output is a reduced list of invariants of cardinal 7 for the {100}-oriented Œ∏ùúÉ\theta fiber, of cardinal 15 for the {110}-oriented Œ±‚Ä≤superscriptùõº‚Ä≤\alpha^{\prime} fiber and of cardinal 8 for the {111}-oriented Œ≥ùõæ\gamma fiber. This reduction (compared to initial cardinal 30) can be of great help for the formulation of low-parameter macroscopic magneto-mechanical models.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 60 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 60"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Symmetry relations for orthotropic and transversely isotropic materials",
        "Further symmetry relations for transversely isotropic materials",
        "Influence of Sulfur on the Recrystallization and {100 }<001 >Cube Texture Formation in Fe48%Ni Alloys Tapes",
        "Finite deformation analysis of isotropic magnetoactive elastomers",
        "Anisotropic creep modelling of the single crystal superalloy SRR99",
        "Symmetry and Magnetism",
        "On a Rational Formulation of Isotropic and Anisotropic Hardening",
        "Ferromagnetism",
        "Theoretical study of magnetostriction in FeTaN thin films",
        "Physics of Ferromagnetism",
        "Introduction to Magnetic Materials",
        "Magnetorheological Elastomers: Experiments and Modeling",
        "Experiments and modeling of iron-particle-filled magnetorheological elastomers",
        "Multiscale modeling of magnetic materials",
        "A multiscale model for reversible ferroelectric behaviour of polycrystalline ceramics",
        "Reversible magneto-elastic behavior: a multiscale approach",
        "Computational Invariant Theory, volume 130 of Encyclopaedia of Mathematical Sciences",
        "Space of 2d elastic materials: a geometric journey",
        "Computation of minimal covariants bases for 2D coupled constitutive laws",
        "Non-quadratic Kelvin modes based plasticity criteria for anisotropic materials",
        "Universal relations for non-linear magnetoelastic solids",
        "Magnetoelastic properties of amorphous alloys",
        "Magnetostriction, Theory and Applications of Magnetoelasticity",
        "Electrodynamics of Continua: Foundations and solid media",
        "Material forces in thermoelastic ferromagnets",
        "FEM for Directly Coupled Magneto-Mechanical Phenomena in Electrical Machines",
        "D√©termination des sym√©tries mat√©rielles de mat√©riaux anisotropes",
        "Les invariants des formes binaires",
        "Macaulay2, a software system for research in algebraic geometry",
        "Magnetic anisotropy and crystalline orientation in high Hk FeCoB thin films",
        "Magnetic Domains. The analysis of magnetic microstructures",
        "Comportement magn√©to-m√©canique des mat√©riaux magn√©tiques",
        "Multiscale magneto-elastic modeling of magnetic materials including isotropic second order stress effect",
        "Texture evolution in twin-roll strip cast non-oriented electrical steel with strong Cube and Goss texture",
        "Constitutive Equations of Nonlinear Electro magnetic-Elastic Crystals",
        "On the constitutive relations for anisotropic materials‚Äîtriclinic, monoclinic, rhombic, tetragonal and hexagonal crystal systems",
        "Electrodynamics of Continuous Media",
        "In-situ neutron diffraction study of martensitic variant redistribution in polycrystalline Ni-Mn-Ga alloy under cyclic thermo-mechanical treatment",
        "Grain-oriented silicon steel sheets",
        "Flexomagneticity in buckled shear deformable hard-magnetic soft structures",
        "Nouveaux alliages Fe-Co magn√©tiques pour la√©ronautique, √† microstructure partiellement recristallis√©e et √† texture fortement orient√©e",
        "About Gordan‚Äôs Algorithm for Binary Forms",
        "A Minimal Integrity Basis for the Elasticity Tensor",
        "Classical Invariant Theory",
        "Development of thin-gauge low iron loss non-oriented silicon steel",
        "A microstructure-dependent anisotropic magneto-electro-elastic Mindlin plate model based on an extended modified couple stress theory",
        "Model for Stress-Dependent Hysteresis in Electrical Steel Sheets Including Orthotropic Anisotropy",
        "On Hooke‚Äôs law",
        "Coupled magnetoelastic theory of magnetic and magnetostrictive hysteresis",
        "Fondements de la Physique des Cristaux",
        "Integrity Bases for a Symmetric Tensor and a Vector‚ÄîThe Crystal Classes, pages 1318‚Äì1358",
        "Calculus On Manifolds",
        "Algorithms in Invariant Theory",
        "Integrity bases for cubic nonlinear magnetostriction",
        "The elastic dielectric",
        "On the through-process texture evolution assessment in grain oriented Fe-3wt%Si steel produced by a novel directional inoculation technique",
        "Effect of cross cold rolling and annealing on microstructure and texture in pure nickel",
        "Piezomagnetic tensors symmetries: an unifying tentative approach",
        "The classical groups",
        "Soft magnetic materials application in the RF range"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 60 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Reduced polynomial invariant integrity basis for in-plane magneto-mechanical loading, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
